Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Manchu \Man*chu"\, a. [Written also Manchoo, Mantchoo, etc.] Of or pertaining to Manchuria or its inhabitants. -- n. A native or inhabitant of Manchuria; also, the language spoken by the Manchus. [1913 Webster]

Manchu n 1: a member of the Manchu speaking people of Mongolian race of Manchuria; related to the Tungus; conquered China in the 17th century 2: the last imperial dynasty of China (from 1644 to 1912) which was overthrown by revolutionaries; during the Qing dynasty China was ruled by the Manchu [syn: {Qing}, {Qing dynasty}, {Ch'ing}, {Ch'ing dynasty}, {Manchu dynasty}] 3: the Tungusic language spoken by the Manchu people
